# The `PPCDispatchGroupSBHazardRecognizer` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/ppcdispatchgroupsbhazardrecognizer">PPCDispatchGroupSBHazardRecognizer</a> - This class implements a scoreboard-based hazard recognizer for <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/ppc">PPC</a> ooo processors with dispatch-group hazards. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Description {#details}

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/ppcdispatchgroupsbhazardrecognizer">PPCDispatchGroupSBHazardRecognizer</a> - This class implements a scoreboard-based hazard recognizer for <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/ppc">PPC</a> ooo processors with dispatch-group hazards.

## Public Member Functions

### AdvanceCycle() {#a1d7b282cd08932b958837df304ab9862}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void PPCDispatchGroupSBHazardRecognizer::AdvanceCycle ()"
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
AdvanceCycle - This callback is invoked whenever the next top-down instruction to be scheduled cannot issue in the current cycle, either because of latency or resource conflicts.

This should increment the internal state of the hazard recognizer so that previously &quot;Hazard&quot; instructions will now not be hazards.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppchazardrecognizers-h/#l00043">43</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppchazardrecognizers-h">PPCHazardRecognizers.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppchazardrecognizers-cpp/#l00205">205</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppchazardrecognizers-cpp">PPCHazardRecognizers.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

<MemberDefinition

EmitInstruction - This callback is invoked when an instruction is emitted, to advance the hazard state.

### getHazardType() {#a12ecb2c77f447a61153a3037607f2dee}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>ScheduleHazardRecognizer::HazardType PPCDispatchGroupSBHazardRecognizer::getHazardType (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sunit">SUnit</a> &#42;, int Stalls)</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
getHazardType - Return the hazard type of emitting this node.

There are three possible results. Either:
<ul>
<li>NoHazard: it is legal to issue this instruction on this cycle.</li>
<li>Hazard: issuing this instruction would stall the machine. If some other instruction is available, issue it first.</li>
<li>NoopHazard: issuing this instruction would break the program. If some other instruction can be issued, do so, otherwise issue a noop.</li>
</ul>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppchazardrecognizers-h/#l00039">39</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppchazardrecognizers-h">PPCHazardRecognizers.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppchazardrecognizers-cpp/#l00139">139</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppchazardrecognizers-cpp">PPCHazardRecognizers.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### PreEmitNoops() {#a57749af083c14fb007c14bd27ab53e8d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>unsigned PPCDispatchGroupSBHazardRecognizer::PreEmitNoops (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sunit">SUnit</a> &#42;)</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
PreEmitNoops - This callback is invoked prior to emitting an instruction.

It should return the number of noops to emit prior to the provided instruction. Note: This is only used during PostRA scheduling. EmitNoop is not called for these noops.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppchazardrecognizers-h/#l00041">41</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppchazardrecognizers-h">PPCHazardRecognizers.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppchazardrecognizers-cpp/#l00155">155</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppchazardrecognizers-cpp">PPCHazardRecognizers.cpp</a>.

### Reset() {#af10ef678b8075734a77485c640b1e0e9}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void PPCDispatchGroupSBHazardRecognizer::Reset ()"
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Reset - This callback is invoked when a new block of instructions is about to be schedule.

The hazard state should be set to an initialized state.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppchazardrecognizers-h/#l00045">45</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppchazardrecognizers-h">PPCHazardRecognizers.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppchazardrecognizers-cpp/#l00213">213</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppchazardrecognizers-cpp">PPCHazardRecognizers.cpp</a>.

### ShouldPreferAnother() {#a747d30e23a3b40029d13eef9703dc9f7}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool PPCDispatchGroupSBHazardRecognizer::ShouldPreferAnother (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sunit">SUnit</a> &#42;)</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
ShouldPreferAnother - This callback may be invoked if getHazardType returns NoHazard.

If, even though there is no hazard, it would be better to schedule another available instruction, this callback should return true.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppchazardrecognizers-h/#l00040">40</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppchazardrecognizers-h">PPCHazardRecognizers.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppchazardrecognizers-cpp/#l00146">146</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppchazardrecognizers-cpp">PPCHazardRecognizers.cpp</a>.
